str2: According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: To open fully. From dia and anoigo; to open thoroughly, literally or figuratively.
Male. Arsen probably from airo; male.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
